pr_title: CLDR-13720 shorten narrow display names for digital units

timeline.message: CLDR-13720 shorten narrow display names for digital units

timeline.bodyText: Why did you change byte to B but not bit to b?
timeline.author: sffc

replies.bodyText:
Maybe because narrow values on bit type are bit, so I assume Mark wanted to keep the logic same as other units. In any case, it's a good question. Maybe if we change displayName from bit to b, we would also need to change the values, but Mark can confirm.
https://github.com/unicode-org/cldr/blob/master/common/main/en.xml#L8069-L8070
replies.author: robertgmelo

replies.bodyText: The question is whether "b" would be recognizable in isolation: "3 b" or "3b". The kb or Mb is distinctive enough, but I'm a bit concerned about the singleton 'b'. But maybe I shouldn't be?
replies.author: macchiati

replies.bodyText: I think you should be. I do not think b is distinctive. I am not even sure that B by itself is distinctive.
